get.summary: Lists permission for a given resource.
Generates a plot.
get.description:
# Example

1. Upload the file `plain_data.csv` with the following content:

```csv
a
1
2
```
2. Create a dataset from it using the "Plain Data" example at `/dataset`.
3. Create a statistics workflow using the "Statistics Plot" example at `/workflow`.
4. Generate the plot with this handler.

metadata.description: metadata used for loading the data

properties.description: properties, for instance, to be rendered in the UI

description.example: A description for an example collection

example.datasetDescription: The Outline of Germany (auto detected format)

BoundingBox2D.description:
A bounding box that includes all border points.
Note: may degenerate to a point!

Colorizer.description:
A colorizer specifies a mapping between raster values and an output image
There are different variants that perform different kinds of mapping.

DataId.description:
The identifier for loadable data. It is used in the source operators to get the loading info (aka parametrization)
for accessing the data. Internal data is loaded from datasets, external from `DataProvider`s.

data.description: Path were the `NetCDF` data can be found

overviews.description: Path were overview files are stored

discreteVrs.description: List of vertical reference systems with a discrete scale

GdalDatasetParameters.description: Parameters for loading data using Gdal

GdalLoadingInfoTemporalSlice.description: one temporal slice of the dataset that requires reading from exactly one Gdal dataset

bandOffset.description:
A band offset specifies the first band index to use for the first point in time.
All other time steps are added to this offset.

end.description:
We use the end to specify the last, non-inclusive valid time point.
Queries behind this point return no data.
TODO: Alternatively, we could think about using the number of possible time steps in the future.

metadata.description: metadata used for loading the data

properties.description: properties, for instance, to be rendered in the UI

entryLabel.description: a common label for the collection's entries, if there is any

properties.description: properties, for instance, to be rendered in the UI

MlTensorShape3D.description: A struct describing tensor shape for `MlModelMetadata`

blueBand.description: The band index of the blue channel.

blueMax.description: The maximum value for the red channel.

blueMin.description: The minimum value for the red channel.

blueScale.description: A scaling factor for the blue channel between 0 and 1.

greenBand.description: The band index of the green channel.

greenMax.description: The maximum value for the red channel.

greenMin.description: The minimum value for the red channel.

greenScale.description: A scaling factor for the green channel between 0 and 1.

noDataColor.description:
The color to use for no data values.
If not specified, the no data values will be transparent.

redBand.description: The band index of the red channel.

redMax.description: The maximum value for the red channel.

redMin.description: The minimum value for the red channel.

redScale.description: A scaling factor for the red channel between 0 and 1.

data.description: Path were the `NetCDF` data can be found

overviews.description: Path were overview files are stored

Palette.description:
A map from value to color

It is assumed that is has at least one and at most 256 entries.

PermissionRequest.description: Request for adding a new permission to the given role on the given resource

PlotQueryRectangle.description: A spatio-temporal rectangle with a specified resolution

RasterDatasetFromWorkflow.description: parameter for the dataset from workflow handler (body)

RasterDatasetFromWorkflowResult.description: response of the dataset from workflow handler

RasterQueryRectangle.description: A spatio-temporal rectangle with a specified resolution

Resource.description: A resource that is affected by a permission.

Secret_String.description:
A wrapper type that serializes to "*****" and can be deserialized from any string.
If the inner value is "*****", it is considered unknown and `as_option` returns `None`.
This is useful for secrets that should not be exposed in API responses, but can be set in API requests.

SpatialPartition2D.description: A partition of space that include the upper left but excludes the lower right coordinate

SpatialReferenceAuthority.description: A spatial reference authority that is part of a spatial reference definition

SpatialReferenceSpecification.description:
The specification of a spatial reference, where extent and axis labels are given
in natural order (x, y) = (east, north)

SpatialResolution.description: The spatial resolution in SRS units

StacQueryBuffer.description: A struct that represents buffers to apply to stac requests

TaskResponse.description: Create a task somewhere and respond with a task id to query the task status.

TimeInterval.description: Stores time intervals in ms in close-open semantic [start, end)

TypedOperator.description: An enum to differentiate between `Operator` variants

metadata.description: metadata used for loading the data

properties.description: properties, for instance, to be rendered in the UI

description.example: A description for an example collection

VectorDataType.description: An enum that contains all possible vector data types

VectorQueryRectangle.description: A spatio-temporal rectangle with a specified resolution
